body_html:
In your Python 3.x shell, can you please run the following:

import imp
print(dir(imp))
print(imp.__file__)

...and let us know what it prints. The find_module() function should be available in Python 3.5, which you appear to be using, so I'm not sure why this would happen. (One possibility is that there's a file called imp.py in your PYTHONPATH, and that's causing it to get confused.)
body_text:
In your Python 3.x shell, can you please run the following:
import imp
print(dir(imp))
print(imp.__file__)
...and let us know what it prints. The find_module() function should be available in Python 3.5, which you appear to be using, so I'm not sure why this would happen. (One possibility is that there's a file called imp.py in your PYTHONPATH, and that's causing it to get confused.)
body:
In your Python 3.x shell, can you please run the following:

``` python
import imp
print(dir(imp))
print(imp.__file__)
```

...and let us know what it prints. The `find_module()` function [should be available](https://docs.python.org/3/library/imp.html#imp.find_module) in Python 3.5, which you appear to be using, so I'm not sure why this would happen. (One possibility is that there's a file called `imp.py` in your PYTHONPATH, and that's causing it to get confused.)
